Package ooga.view

Class ViewManager

java.lang.Object
ooga.view.ViewManager
public class ViewManager
extends java.lang.Object
Instantiates and manages all views for a single game instance. This class controls the flow of GameWindow and GameScene objects based on user button clicks, switching scenes and showing/closing windows as necessary.

  • Constructor Details

    • ViewManager

      public ViewManager​(java.util.ResourceBundle initFile)
      Creates a new instance of ViewManager with a resource bundle with information about the first window to show. The constructor then shows the first window. This constructor assumes tat the first scene created is a window of type Stage.
      Parameters:
      initFile - a ResourceBundle with specifications for the first window.

  • Method Details

    • handleStageClose

      private void handleStageClose()
      All methods in here are run when the user closes the window. Do any saving operations here.

    • createControllers

      private void createControllers()
      Creates the necessary BoardController and ModelController objects.

    • positionWindow

      private void positionWindow​(javafx.stage.Stage window, int x, int y)

    • makeScene

      private GameScene makeScene​(java.lang.String sceneNameProperty)
      Changes the scene of the primary GameWindow to the desired scene. The scene name is specified by an input String that corresponds to a property in the init.properties file that points to the name of an existing GameScene class.
      Parameters:
      sceneNameProperty - the property key corresponding to the name of an existing GameScene class.
      Returns:
      a GameScene subclass of the desired type.

    • onButtonClicked

      private void onButtonClicked​(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Handles button clicks. This method assumes that the source of the incoming ActionEvent is of type Button. Then it uses reflection to call methods in this class based on the ID of the button pressed.
      Parameters:
      e -

    • startGame

      public void startGame​(java.lang.String gameType)
      Starts the game by changing the scene of the current window to a BoardScene instance. This also gives the ModelController its game type so that it can initialize the correct game files.
      Parameters:
      gameType - a String for the game type.

    • showConfigMenu

      private void showConfigMenu()
      Shows a FloatingWindow with the configuration menu for the game.

      private void chess()

      private void changeBackgroundButton()

    • changeBackground

      private void changeBackground​(java.lang.String url)
      Changes the background of the BoardScene.
      Parameters:
      url - the url of the image desired

    • cancelButton

      private void cancelButton()
      Dismisses the GameConfigScene and restarts the ViewManager.

    • quit

      private void quit()
      Closes the primary GameWindow and exits the game.

    • makeFloatingWindow

      private FloatingWindow makeFloatingWindow​(GameScene scene)
      Creates a new empty FloatingWindow instance and preset its owner window to the primary window of this game instance. This also sets the scene for the window to display.
      Returns:
      a FloatingWindow with no scene specified

    • getInitialWindow

      private GameWindow getInitialWindow()
      Gets the correct subclass of GameWindow to show the initial window of the game. This searches for the "initialWindowType" attribute in the init file and instantiates the window type requested. Will print to stacktrace if instantiation fails.
      Returns:
      a GameWindow instance.
